page.title: 14Special day in Oystermouth
page.content: I woke up and remembered it was the day of the annual "Womble". After breakfast I went to meet the rest of the group at the "Big Apple" in Limeslade Bay. Our group was clearing the litter on Mumbles Hill. When at work we found an air-raid shelter used during the war. At our Womble we ask our friends and relatives to sponsor us to tidy up the area. The money we earn goes towards buying something special for the school. We left Bracelet Bay at 12 o'clock wearing our Womble Badge for 1985. This badge was our pass to the barbecue organised by the parents for the Womblers at Rotherslade Bay. By Hannah Richardson.
